title: What contemporary photographer best captures the human spirit? - Quora

response.answer_text: Venezuela Crisis by Ronald Schemidt, winner of World Press Photo of the Year prize in 2018[1]  Exuberance by Christine Kapuschinsky Johnson, USA, Open Smile, 2015 Sony World Photography Awards[2]  A Spaceman walking in Soho by Phil Penman, 2015[3]  2018 UCI Para-cycling Road World Championships in Maniago (Italy) by Alex Whitehead[4]  Europe’s Refugee Crisis by Sergey Ponomarev, 2015. Migrants arrive by a Turkish boat near the village of Skala, on the Greek island of Lesbos.[5]  Happiness, 2005 Photo Contest By Chee Keong Lim, Malaysia[6]  Makha Bucha Day: 100,000 monks pray for world peace, Thailand by Luke Duggleby[7]  Crying and Laughing, Indonesia, 2016 by Agussyarif Hanafie [8]  Sharing Emotions, Siena International Photo Awards by Mohd Nazri Sulaiman,2018[9]   The Twins’ Gymnastics Dream, China, Siena International Photo Awards by Peng Yuan[10]  Beyond Pink, USA by Becky Yee[11]  Can you feel the human spirit? Footnotes[1] Ronaldo Schemidt wins World Press Photo of the Year 2018 award[2] 24 Of The Best Photographs From 2015 Sony World Photography Awards Shortlist[3] Photographer captures striking images of everyday life in New York[4] 2018 Mark Gunter Photographer of the Year Awards: the judges' shortlist | CyclingTips[5] Europe's Refugee Crisis by Sergey Ponomarev[6] “Happiness” by Chee Keong Lim, Malasya[7] http://www.lukeduggleby.com/singles[8] GuruShots | The World's Greatest Photography Game[9] Sharing emotion Photo by Mohd nazri Sulaiman — National Geographic Your Shot[10] 1st Place, Yuan Peng, China[11] Beyond PINK Portraits — Becky Yee Photography
